segments.text: The kitchen has an air of domesticity, but I can't shake the sense of impending disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see that woman drying her plate, blissfully unaware of the flood creeping around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open window lets in soft light, but it feels more like a spotlight on the chaos within.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy stretches up, almost defying gravity, seeking his prize from the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel disgusted by the mess that water is creating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost like a metaphor for their childhood, teetering on the edge of trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, there’s also an innocence in their ambition, a sweetness in their heist.
segments.speaker: PAR
